intro: Trimezia sooretamensis, commonly known as the Sooretama trimezia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet, tropical environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a unique structure that includes a central spadix surrounded by bracts. Trimezia sooretamensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
